content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is possible to work it out as a reverse quickest clash.

can you add an easy test case and validator between the reverse and random test like:
input:
1 2
3 4
5 6
7 8
output:
19 22
43 50

i am little worry about the REVERSE mode....you  might only see test 1 and 2 to calculate what you need... because other cases have big numbers

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good simple puzzle. Seen it before, but duplicates are allowed if they have different descriptions and tests. It's good that the exact way to solve it is explained, so people don't have to look it up externally.
Nice puzzle :)

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice and easy

Goal
* Please rewrite as follows:

Given two 2x2 matrices, multiply them and return the result as a 2x2 matrix.

* Please explain how the multiplication is done.

Input
* Please delete the examples. An example has been shown in Example section.

* Please change "first 2 lines" to "<<First 2 lines>>" (capitalised and formatted in bold).

* Please change "second 2 lines" to "<<Next 2 lines>>" (changed the first word and formatted in bold).

Output
* Please rewrite the whole section as follows:

<<2 lines>>: Space separated values of the resultant matrix

Constraints
* Please change "matrix" to "matrices".

* Please change "an integer" to "integers".

Cases
* Each pair of test and validator should be similar (but not the same), e.g.
  â€¢ Test 1: Simple case
  â€¢ Validator 1: Simple case (different input)
  â€¢ Test 2: Identity
  â€¢ Validator 2: Identity (different input)
  (etc.)
  
  Please revise the cases accordingly. You can also have more than 4 pairs of cases if necessary.

Stub generator
* Line 1 and Line 2: Please change as follows:

loop 2 loopline 2 a:int
loop 2 loopline 2 b:int

Thanks.
thank you so much for your feedback this is my  first contribution i will fix those issues now
fixed the issues

The following issues haven't been addressed:

Goal
* Please explain how the multiplication is done. The explanation is needed because this is a test on programming knowledge, not maths knowledge.

Cases
* Each pair of test and validator should be similar (but not the same), e.g.
  â€¢ Test 1: Simple case
  â€¢ Validator 1: Simple case (different input)
  â€¢ Test 2: Identity
  â€¢ Validator 2: Identity (different input)
  (etc.)
  
  Please revise the cases accordingly. You can also have more than 4 pairs of cases if necessary.

Thanks.
Hope I fixed those issues thank you for addressing those again.

Goal
* Only an explanation is needed. A pseudo-code is far too much and it is not easy to read anyway. You may refer to this statement as an example:

https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/4067149503049b770612dbbf6fdb73a9b862f

Cases
* For the random cases, would you please increase the magnitude of the input values to somewhere between 10 to 100?

* For the Hard test only (not the validator), would you please increase the magnitude of the input values to somewhere between 100 to 1000, to match the validator?

Thanks.
Thanks.

I believe you're still editing the statement and the casesâ€¦?

It doesn't help if at the same time you don't show where a, b, c, etc come from ðŸ˜… and you need some text to describe what you've put there.

Something like:

If the input matrices are:
xxxxxxx

Then the product matrix is:
xxxxxxx
Edited and is eager to make it as good as possible.

That's more like it! Now, you may apply some multi-line monospace format to the matrices so that the text aligns correctly. You put 3 backticks before and after the matrices like this:

```
(matrix line 1)
(matrix line 2)
```

Also, as mentioned, please revise the cases:

Cases
* For the random cases, would you please increase the magnitude of the input values to somewhere between 10 to 100?

* For the Hard test only (not the validator), would you please increase the magnitude of the input values to somewhere between 100 to 1000, to match the validator?

Thanks.

Goal
* Please note that I've deleted 4 spaces in front of "(g h)" for proper alignment.

* Please change "those matrix" to "those matrices".

Cases
* Hard (test): Please change 13, 54 and 43 to other integers between 100 to 1000. The reason is that each pair of test and validator should be as similar as possible.

Thanks.
updated :_smile_:

Let me clarify further:

When designing cases that span a wide range of values, it's important to:

(a) Ensure that different magnitudes are covered evenly. This prevents sudden jumps from very small values to very large values while neglecting medium values.

(b) Align each pair of test and validator to cover similar magnitudes consistently.

For example:

â€¢ Test 1 and Validator 1 cover small values.
â€¢ Test 2 and Validator 2 cover slightly larger values.
â€¢ Test 3 and Validator 3 cover even larger values.
â€¢ Test 4 and Validator 4 cover very large values.

This approach ensures comprehensive and balanced coverage across all magnitudes.

With this design principle in mind, Hard (test) and Hard (validator) are not similar at all. You may change the input of Hard (test) to, for example,

843 54
65 54
649 445
945 343

Hope this clarifies.
Updated any other stuff to fix?

I don't see any other stuff to fix for the time being. However, I hope that you understand the reasons behind the previous fixes, so that you can apply the same principles when you create contributions in the future. ðŸ˜‰
Thank You I will create more contributions like this one.
Will You give an upvote?
